00032 #ifndef __LIBNET_HEADERS_H
00033 #define __LIBNET_HEADERS_H
00034 /*
00035  * @file libnet-headers.h
00036  * @brief libnet header information
00037  */
00038 
00039 /*
00040  * Libnet defines header sizes for every builder function exported.
00041  */
00042 #define LIBNET_802_1Q_H         0x12    
00043 #define LIBNET_802_1X_H         0x04    
00044 #define LIBNET_802_2_H          0x03    
00045 #define LIBNET_802_2SNAP_H      0x08    
00046 #define LIBNET_802_3_H          0x0e    
00047 #define LIBNET_ARP_H            0x08    
00048 #define LIBNET_ARP_ETH_IP_H     0x1c    
00049 #define LIBNET_BGP4_HEADER_H    0x13    
00050 #define LIBNET_BGP4_OPEN_H      0x0a    
00051 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UPDATE_H    0x04    
00052 #define LIBNET_BGP4_NOTIFICATION_H 0x02 
00053 #define LIBNET_CDP_H            0x08    
00054 #define LIBNET_DHCPV4_H         0xf0    
00055 #define LIBNET_UDP_DNSV4_H      0x0c    
00056 #define LIBNET_TCP_DNSV4_H      0x0e    
00057 #define LIBNET_ETH_H            0x0e    
00058 #define LIBNET_FDDI_H           0x15    
00059 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_H         0x04    
00060 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_ECHO_H    0x08    
00061 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_MASK_H    0x0c    
00062 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_UNREACH_H  0x08   
00063 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_TIMXCEED_H 0x08   
00064 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_REDIRECT_H 0x08   
00065 #define LIBNET_ICMPV4_TS_H      0x14    
00066 #define LIBNET_ICMPV6_H         0x08    
00067 #define LIBNET_IGMP_H           0x08    
00068 #define LIBNET_IPV4_H           0x14    
00069 #define LIBNET_IPV6_H           0x28    
00070 #define LIBNET_IPV6_FRAG_H      0x08    
00071 #define LIBNET_IPV6_ROUTING_H   0x04    
00072 #define LIBNET_IPV6_DESTOPTS_H  0x02    
00073 #define LIBNET_IPV6_HBHOPTS_H   0x02    
00074 #define LIBNET_IPSEC_ESP_HDR_H  0x0c    
00075 #define LIBNET_IPSEC_ESP_FTR_H  0x02    
00076 #define LIBNET_IPSEC_AH_H       0x10    
00077 #define LIBNET_ISL_H            0x1a    
00078 #define LIBNET_GRE_H            0x04    
00079 #define LIBNET_GRE_SRE_H        0x04    
00080 #define LIBNET_MPLS_H           0x04    
00081 #define LIBNET_OSPF_H           0x10    
00082 #define LIBNET_OSPF_HELLO_H     0x18    
00083 #define LIBNET_OSPF_DBD_H       0x08    
00084 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LSR_H       0x0c    
00085 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LSU_H       0x04    
00086 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LSA_H       0x14    
00087 #define LIBNET_OSPF_AUTH_H      0x08    
00088 #define LIBNET_OSPF_CKSUM       0x10    
00089 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LS_RTR_H    0x10    
00090 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LS_NET_H    0x08    
00091 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LS_SUM_H    0x0c    
00092 #define LIBNET_OSPF_LS_AS_EXT_H 0x10    
00093 #define LIBNET_NTP_H            0x30    
00094 #define LIBNET_RIP_H            0x18    
00095 #define LIBNET_RPC_CALL_H       0x28    
00098 #define LIBNET_RPC_CALL_TCP_H   0x2c    
00101 #define LIBNET_SEBEK_H          0x30    /* sebek header:          48 bytes */   
00102 #define LIBNET_STP_CONF_H       0x23    
00103 #define LIBNET_STP_TCN_H        0x04    
00104 #define LIBNET_TOKEN_RING_H     0x16    
00105 #define LIBNET_TCP_H            0x14    
00106 #define LIBNET_UDP_H            0x08    
00107 #define LIBNET_VRRP_H           0x08    
00108 #define LIBNET_HSRP_H           0x14    
00110 /*
00111  * IEEE 802.1Q (Virtual Local Area Network) VLAN header, static header 
00112  * size: 18 bytes
00113  */
00114 struct libnet_802_1q_hdr
00115 {
00116     u_int8_t vlan_dhost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];  
00117     u_int8_t vlan_shost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];  
00118     u_int16_t vlan_tpi;                   
00119     u_int16_t vlan_priority_c_vid;        
00120 #define LIBNET_802_1Q_PRIMASK   0x0007    
00121 #define LIBNET_802_1Q_CFIMASK   0x0001    
00122 #define LIBNET_802_1Q_VIDMASK   0x0fff    
00123     u_int16_t vlan_len;                   
00124 };  
00125 
00126 /*
00127  * IEEE 802.1X EAP (Extensible Authentication Protocol) header, static header
00128  * size: 4 bytes
00129  */
00130 struct libnet_802_1x_hdr
00131 {
00132     u_int8_t dot1x_version;               
00133     u_int8_t dot1x_type;                  
00134 #define LIBNET_802_1X_PACKET    0x00      
00135 #define LIBNET_802_1X_START     0x01      
00136 #define LIBNET_802_1X_LOGOFF    0x02      
00137 #define LIBNET_802_1X_KEY       0x03      
00138 #define LIBNET_802_1X_ENCASFAL  0x04      
00139     u_int16_t dot1x_length;               
00140 };  
00141 
00142 /*
00143  *  IEEE 802.2 LLC header
00144  *  Link Layer Control
00145  *  static header size: 3 bytes
00146  */
00147 struct libnet_802_2_hdr
00148 {
00149     u_int8_t llc_dsap;            /* destination service access point */
00150     u_int8_t llc_ssap;            /* source service access point */
00151 #define LIBNET_SAP_STP          0x42
00152 #define LIBNET_SAP_SNAP         0xaa
00153     u_int8_t llc_control;         /* control field */
00154 };
00155 
00156 
00157 /*
00158  *  IEEE 802.2 LLC/SNAP header
00159  *  SubNetwork Attachment Point
00160  *  static header size: 8 bytes
00161  */
00162 struct libnet_802_2snap_hdr
00163 {
00164     u_int8_t snap_dsap;           /* destination service access point */
00165     u_int8_t snap_ssap;           /* destination service access point */
00166     u_int8_t snap_control;        /* control field */
00167     u_int8_t snap_oui[3];         /* OUI */
00168     u_int16_t snap_type;          /* type */
00169 };
00170 
00171 
00172 /*
00173  *  802.3 header
00174  *  IEEE Ethernet
00175  *  Static header size: 14 bytes
00176  */
00177 struct libnet_802_3_hdr
00178 {
00179     u_int8_t  _802_3_dhost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];/* destination ethernet address */
00180     u_int8_t  _802_3_shost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];/* source ethernet address */
00181     u_int16_t _802_3_len;                 /* packet type ID */
00182 };
00183 
00184 
00185 /* 
00186  *  ARP header
00187  *  Address Resolution Protocol
00188  *  Base header size: 8 bytes
00189  */
00190 struct libnet_arp_hdr
00191 {
00192     u_int16_t ar_hrd;         /* format of hardware address */
00193 #define ARPHRD_NETROM   0   /* from KA9Q: NET/ROM pseudo */
00194 #define ARPHRD_ETHER    1   /* Ethernet 10Mbps */
00195 #define ARPHRD_EETHER   2   /* Experimental Ethernet */
00196 #define ARPHRD_AX25     3   /* AX.25 Level 2 */
00197 #define ARPHRD_PRONET   4   /* PROnet token ring */
00198 #define ARPHRD_CHAOS    5   /* Chaosnet */
00199 #define ARPHRD_IEEE802  6   /* IEEE 802.2 Ethernet/TR/TB */
00200 #define ARPHRD_ARCNET   7   /* ARCnet */
00201 #define ARPHRD_APPLETLK 8   /* APPLEtalk */
00202 #define ARPHRD_LANSTAR  9   /* Lanstar */
00203 #define ARPHRD_DLCI     15  /* Frame Relay DLCI */
00204 #define ARPHRD_ATM      19  /* ATM */
00205 #define ARPHRD_METRICOM 23  /* Metricom STRIP (new IANA id) */
00206 #define ARPHRD_IPSEC    31  /* IPsec tunnel */
00207     u_int16_t ar_pro;         /* format of protocol address */
00208     u_int8_t  ar_hln;         /* length of hardware address */
00209     u_int8_t  ar_pln;         /* length of protocol addres */
00210     u_int16_t ar_op;          /* operation type */
00211 #define ARPOP_REQUEST    1  /* req to resolve address */
00212 #define ARPOP_REPLY      2  /* resp to previous request */
00213 #define ARPOP_REVREQUEST 3  /* req protocol address given hardware */
00214 #define ARPOP_REVREPLY   4  /* resp giving protocol address */
00215 #define ARPOP_INVREQUEST 8  /* req to identify peer */
00216 #define ARPOP_INVREPLY   9  /* resp identifying peer */
00217     /* address information allocated dynamically */
00218 };
00219 
00220 /*
00221  * BGP4 header
00222  * Border Gateway Protocol 4
00223  * Base header size : 19 bytes
00224  */
00225 struct libnet_bgp4_header_hdr
00226 {
00227 #define LIBNET_BGP4_MARKER_SIZE   16
00228     u_int8_t marker[LIBNET_BGP4_MARKER_SIZE];
00229     u_int16_t len;
00230     u_int8_t type;
00231 #define LIBNET_BGP4_OPEN          1
00232 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UPDATE        2
00233 #define LIBNET_BGP4_NOTIFICATION  3
00234 #define LIBNET_BGP4_KEEPALIVE     4
00235 };
00236 
00237 /*
00238  * BGP4 open header
00239  * Border Gateway Protocol 4
00240  * Base header size : 10 bytes
00241  */
00242 struct libnet_bgp4_open_hdr
00243 {
00244     u_int8_t version;
00245     u_int16_t src_as;
00246     u_int16_t hold_time;
00247     u_int32_t bgp_id;
00248     u_int8_t opt_len;
00249 };
00250 
00251 /*
00252  * BGP4 notification message
00253  *
00254  * Border Gateway Protocol 4
00255  * Base header size : 2 bytes
00256  *
00257  * Use payload if you need data
00258  */
00259 struct libnet_bgp4_notification_hdr
00260 {
00261 #define LIBNET_BGP4_MESSAGE_HEADER_ERROR  1
00262 #define LIBNET_BGP4_OPEN_MESSAGE_ERROR    2
00263 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UPDATE_MESSAGE_ERROR  3
00264 #define LIBNET_BGP4_HOLD_TIMER_EXPIRED    4
00265 #define LIBNET_BGP4_FINITE_STATE__ERROR   5
00266 #define LIBNET_BGP4_CEASE                 6
00267     u_int8_t err_code;
00268 
00269 /* Message Header Error subcodes */
00270 #define LIBNET_BGP4_CONNECTION_NOT_SYNCHRONIZED    1
00271 #define LIBNET_BGP4_BAD_MESSAGE_LENGTH             2
00272 #define LIBNET_BGP4_BAD_MESSAGE_TYPE               3
00273 /* OPEN Message Error subcodes */
00274 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION_NUMBER     1
00275 #define LIBNET_BGP4_BAD_PEER_AS                    2
00276 #define LIBNET_BGP4_BAD_BGP_IDENTIFIER             3
00277 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UNSUPPORTED_OPTIONAL_PARAMETER 4
00278 #define LIBNET_BGP4_AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE         5
00279 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UNACCEPTABLE_HOLD_TIME         6
00280 /* UPDATE Message Error subcodes */
00281 #define LIBNET_BGP4_MALFORMED_ATTRIBUTE_LIST
00282 #define LIBNET_BGP4_UNRECOGNIZED_WELL_KNOWN_ATTRIBUTE
00283 #define LIBNET_BGP4_MISSING_WELL_KNOWN_ATTRIBUTE
00284 #define LIBNET_BGP4_ATTRIBUTE_FLAGS_ERROR
00285 #define LIBNET_BGP4_ATTRIBUTE_LENGTH_ERROR
00286 #define LIBNET_BGP4_INVALID_ORIGIN_ATTRIBUTE
00287 #define LIBNET_BGP4_AS_ROUTING_LOOP
00288 #define LIBNET_BGP4_INVALID_NEXT_HOP_ATTRIBUTE
00289 #define LIBNET_BGP4_OPTIONAL_ATTRIBUTE_ERROR
00290 #define LIBNET_BGP4_INVALID_NETWORK_FIELD
00291 #define LIBNET_BGP4_MALFORMED_AS_PATH
00292     u_int8_t err_subcode;
00293 };
00294 
00295 
00296 
00297 /*
00298  *  For checksum stuff -- IANA says 135-254 is "unassigned" as of 12.2001.
00299  *  Let's hope this one stays that way for a while!
00300  */
00301 #define LIBNET_PROTO_CDP    200
00302 
00303 /*
00304  *  CDP header
00305  *  Cisco Discovery Protocol
00306  *  Base header size: 8 bytes
00307  */
00308 struct libnet_cdp_hdr
00309 {
00310     u_int8_t cdp_version;     /* version (should always be 0x01) */
00311     u_int8_t cdp_ttl;         /* time reciever should hold info in this packet */
00312     u_int16_t cdp_sum;        /* checksum */
00313     u_int16_t cdp_type;       /* type */
00314 #define LIBNET_CDP_DEVID    0x1 /* device id */
00315 #define LIBNET_CDP_ADDRESS  0x2 /* address */
00316 #define LIBNET_CDP_PORTID   0x3 /* port id */
00317 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAPABIL  0x4 /* capabilities */
00318 #define LIBNET_CDP_VERSION  0x5 /* version */
00319 #define LIBNET_CDP_PLATFORM 0x6 /* platform */
00320 #define LIBNET_CDP_IPPREFIX 0x7 /* ip prefix */
00321     u_int16_t cdp_len;        /* type + length + value */
00322     /* value information done dynamically */
00323 
00324 /* CDP capabilities */
00325 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_L3R  0x01/* performs level 3 routing */
00326 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_L2B  0x02/* performs level 2 transparent bridging */
00327 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_L2SRB 0x04/* performs level 2 sourceroute bridging */
00328 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_L2S  0x08/* performs level 2 switching */
00329 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_SR   0x10/* sends and recieves packets on a network */
00330 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_NOI  0x20/* does not forward IGMP on non-router ports */
00331 #define LIBNET_CDP_CAP_L1F  0x40/* provides level 1 functionality */
00332 };
00333 
00334 
00335 /*
00336  *  Used as an overlay for type/len/values
00337  */
00338 struct libnet_cdp_value_hdr
00339 {
00340     u_int16_t cdp_type;
00341     u_int16_t cdp_len;
00342 };
00343 
00344 
00345 /*
00346  *  DHCP header
00347  *  Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol
00348  *  Static header size: f0 bytes
00349  */
00350 struct libnet_dhcpv4_hdr
00351 {
00352     u_int8_t dhcp_opcode;     /* opcode */
00353 #define LIBNET_DHCP_REQUEST 0x1
00354 #define LIBNET_DHCP_REPLY   0x2
00355     u_int8_t dhcp_htype;      /* hardware address type */
00356     u_int8_t dhcp_hlen;       /* hardware address length */
00357     u_int8_t dhcp_hopcount;   /* used by proxy servers */
00358     u_int32_t dhcp_xid;        /* transaction ID */
00359     u_int16_t dhcp_secs;      /* number of seconds since trying to bootstrap */
00360     u_int16_t dhcp_flags;     /* flags for DHCP, unused for BOOTP */
00361     u_int32_t dhcp_cip;        /* client's IP */
00362     u_int32_t dhcp_yip;        /* your IP */
00363     u_int32_t dhcp_sip;        /* server's IP */
00364     u_int32_t dhcp_gip;        /* gateway IP */
00365     u_int8_t dhcp_chaddr[16]; /* client hardware address */
00366     u_int8_t dhcp_sname[64];  /* server host name */
00367     u_int8_t dhcp_file[128];  /* boot file name */
00368     u_int32_t dhcp_magic;      /* BOOTP magic header */
00369 #define DHCP_MAGIC                  0x63825363
00370 #define LIBNET_BOOTP_MIN_LEN        0x12c
00371 #define LIBNET_DHCP_PAD             0x00
00372 #define LIBNET_DHCP_SUBNETMASK      0x01
00373 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TIMEOFFSET      0x02
00374 #define LIBNET_DHCP_ROUTER          0x03
00375 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TIMESERVER      0x04
00376 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NAMESERVER      0x05
00377 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DNS             0x06
00378 #define LIBNET_DHCP_LOGSERV         0x07
00379 #define LIBNET_DHCP_COOKIESERV      0x08
00380 #define LIBNET_DHCP_LPRSERV         0x09
00381 #define LIBNET_DHCP_IMPSERV         0x0a
00382 #define LIBNET_DHCP_RESSERV         0x0b
00383 #define LIBNET_DHCP_HOSTNAME        0x0c
00384 #define LIBNET_DHCP_BOOTFILESIZE    0x0d
00385 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DUMPFILE        0x0e
00386 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DOMAINNAME      0x0f
00387 #define LIBNET_DHCP_SWAPSERV        0x10
00388 #define LIBNET_DHCP_ROOTPATH        0x11
00389 #define LIBNET_DHCP_EXTENPATH       0x12
00390 #define LIBNET_DHCP_IPFORWARD       0x13
00391 #define LIBNET_DHCP_SRCROUTE        0x14
00392 #define LIBNET_DHCP_POLICYFILTER    0x15
00393 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MAXASMSIZE      0x16
00394 #define LIBNET_DHCP_IPTTL           0x17
00395 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MTUTIMEOUT      0x18
00396 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MTUTABLE        0x19
00397 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MTUSIZE         0x1a
00398 #define LIBNET_DHCP_LOCALSUBNETS    0x1b
00399 #define LIBNET_DHCP_BROADCASTADDR   0x1c
00400 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DOMASKDISCOV    0x1d
00401 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MASKSUPPLY      0x1e
00402 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DOROUTEDISC     0x1f
00403 #define LIBNET_DHCP_ROUTERSOLICIT   0x20
00404 #define LIBNET_DHCP_STATICROUTE     0x21
00405 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TRAILERENCAP    0x22
00406 #define LIBNET_DHCP_ARPTIMEOUT      0x23
00407 #define LIBNET_DHCP_ETHERENCAP      0x24
00408 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TCPTTL          0x25
00409 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TCPKEEPALIVE    0x26
00410 #define LIBNET_DHCP_TCPALIVEGARBAGE 0x27
00411 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NISDOMAIN       0x28
00412 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NISSERVERS      0x29
00413 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NISTIMESERV     0x2a
00414 #define LIBNET_DHCP_VENDSPECIFIC    0x2b
00415 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NBNS            0x2c
00416 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NBDD            0x2d
00417 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NBTCPIP         0x2e
00418 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NBTCPSCOPE      0x2f
00419 #define LIBNET_DHCP_XFONT           0x30
00420 #define LIBNET_DHCP_XDISPLAYMGR     0x31
00421 #define LIBNET_DHCP_DISCOVERADDR    0x32
00422 #define LIBNET_DHCP_LEASETIME       0x33
00423 #define LIBNET_DHCP_OPTIONOVERLOAD  0x34
00424 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MESSAGETYPE     0x35
00425 #define LIBNET_DHCP_SERVIDENT       0x36
00426 #define LIBNET_DHCP_PARAMREQUEST    0x37
00427 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MESSAGE         0x38
00428 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MAXMSGSIZE      0x39
00429 #define LIBNET_DHCP_RENEWTIME       0x3a
00430 #define LIBNET_DHCP_REBINDTIME      0x3b
00431 #define LIBNET_DHCP_CLASSSID        0x3c
00432 #define LIBNET_DHCP_CLIENTID        0x3d
00433 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NISPLUSDOMAIN   0x40
00434 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NISPLUSSERVERS  0x41
00435 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MOBILEIPAGENT   0x44
00436 #define LIBNET_DHCP_SMTPSERVER      0x45
00437 #define LIBNET_DHCP_POP3SERVER      0x46
00438 #define LIBNET_DHCP_NNTPSERVER      0x47
00439 #define LIBNET_DHCP_WWWSERVER       0x48
00440 #define LIBNET_DHCP_FINGERSERVER    0x49
00441 #define LIBNET_DHCP_IRCSERVER       0x4a
00442 #define LIBNET_DHCP_STSERVER        0x4b
00443 #define LIBNET_DHCP_STDASERVER      0x4c
00444 #define LIBNET_DHCP_END             0xff
00445 
00446 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGDISCOVER     0x01
00447 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGOFFER        0x02
00448 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGREQUEST      0x03
00449 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGDECLINE      0x04
00450 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGACK          0x05
00451 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGNACK         0x06
00452 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGRELEASE      0x07
00453 #define LIBNET_DHCP_MSGINFORM       0x08
00454 };

00457 /* this little guy got left out in the cold */
00458 #define LIBNET_DNS_H LIBNET_UDP_DNSV4_H
00459 /*
00460  *  Base DNSv4 header
00461  *  Domain Name System
00462  *  Base header size: 12/14 bytes
00463  */
00464 struct libnet_dnsv4_hdr
00465 {
00466     u_int16_t h_len;          /* length of the packet - only used with TCP */
00467     u_int16_t id;             /* DNS packet ID */
00468     u_int16_t flags;          /* DNS flags */
00469     u_int16_t num_q;          /* Number of questions */
00470     u_int16_t num_answ_rr;    /* Number of answer resource records */
00471     u_int16_t num_auth_rr;    /* Number of authority resource records */
00472     u_int16_t num_addi_rr;    /* Number of additional resource records */
00473 };
00474 
00475 #define LIBNET_DNS_H LIBNET_UDP_DNSV4_H
00476 struct libnet_dnsv4udp_hdr
00477 {
00478     u_int16_t id;             /* DNS packet ID */
00479     u_int16_t flags;          /* DNS flags */
00480     u_int16_t num_q;          /* Number of questions */
00481     u_int16_t num_answ_rr;    /* Number of answer resource records */
00482     u_int16_t num_auth_rr;    /* Number of authority resource records */
00483     u_int16_t num_addi_rr;    /* Number of additional resource records */
00484 };
00485 
00486 /*
00487  *  Ethernet II header
00488  *  Static header size: 14 bytes
00489  */
00490 struct libnet_ethernet_hdr
00491 {
00492     u_int8_t  ether_dhost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];/* destination ethernet address */
00493     u_int8_t  ether_shost[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];/* source ethernet address */
00494     u_int16_t ether_type;                 /* protocol */
00495 };
00496 
00497 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_PUP
00498 #define ETHERTYPE_PUP           0x0200  /* PUP protocol */
00499 #endif
00500 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_IP
00501 #define ETHERTYPE_IP            0x0800  /* IP protocol */
00502 #endif
00503 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_ARP
00504 #define ETHERTYPE_ARP           0x0806  /* addr. resolution protocol */
00505 #endif
00506 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_REVARP
00507 #define ETHERTYPE_REVARP        0x8035  /* reverse addr. resolution protocol */
00508 #endif
00509 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_VLAN
00510 #define ETHERTYPE_VLAN          0x8100  /* IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tagging */
00511 #endif
00512 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_EAP
00513 #define ETHERTYPE_EAP           0x888e  /* IEEE 802.1X EAP authentication */
00514 #endif
00515 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_MPLS
00516 #define ETHERTYPE_MPLS          0x8847  /* MPLS */
00517 #endif
00518 #ifndef ETHERTYPE_LOOPBACK
00519 #define ETHERTYPE_LOOPBACK      0x9000  /* used to test interfaces */
00520 #endif
00521 
00522 struct libnet_ether_addr
00523 {
00524     u_int8_t  ether_addr_octet[6];        /* Ethernet address */
00525 };
00526 
00527 /*
00528  *  Fiber Distributed Data Interface header
00529  *
00530  *  Static header size: 21 bytes (LLC and 48-bit address addr only)
00531  *
00532  *  Note: Organization field is 3 bytes which throws off the
00533  *        alignment of type.  Therefore fddi_type (19 bytes in) 
00534  *        is specified as two u_int8_ts.
00535  */
00536 struct libnet_fddi_hdr
00537 {
00538     u_int8_t  fddi_frame_control;                      /* Class/Format/Priority */
00539 #define LIBNET_FDDI_LLC_FRAME  0x10
00540 #define LIBNET_FDDI_48BIT_ADDR 0x40
00541 #define LIBNET_FDDI_FC_REQD    LIBNET_FDDI_LLC_FRAME | LIBNET_FDDI_48BIT_ADDR 
00542     u_int8_t  fddi_dhost[FDDI_ADDR_LEN];               /* destination fddi address */
00543     u_int8_t  fddi_shost[FDDI_ADDR_LEN];               /* source fddi address */
00544     u_int8_t  fddi_llc_dsap;                           /* DSAP */
00545     u_int8_t  fddi_llc_ssap;                           /* SSAP */
00546     u_int8_t  fddi_llc_control_field;                  /* Class/Format/Priority */
00547     u_int8_t  fddi_llc_org_code[LIBNET_ORG_CODE_SIZE]; /* Organization Code 3-bytes */
00548     u_int8_t  fddi_type;                               /* Protocol Type */
00549     u_int8_t  fddi_type1;                              /* see note above. */
00550 #define FDDI_TYPE_IP            0x0800  /* IP protocol */
00551 #define FDDI_TYPE_ARP           0x0806  /* addr. resolution protocol */
00552 #define FDDI_TYPE_REVARP        0x8035  /* reverse addr. resolution protocol */
00553 };
00554 
00555 
00556 struct libnet_fddi_addr
00557 {
00558     u_int8_t  fddi_addr_octet[6];        /* FDDI address */
00559 };
00560 
00561 
00562 /*
00563  * GRE header - RFC 1701 & 2637
00564  * Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) 
00565  * Base header size: 4 bytes
00566  */
00567 struct libnet_gre_hdr
00568 {
00569     u_int16_t flags_ver;
00570 #define GRE_CSUM                            0x8000
00571 #define GRE_ROUTING                         0x4000
00572 #define GRE_KEY                             0x2000
00573 #define GRE_SEQ                             0x1000
00574 #define GRE_STRICT                          0x0800
00575 #define GRE_REC                             0x0700
00576 #define GRE_ACK                             0x0080
00577 
00578 #define GRE_FLAGS_MASK                          0x00F8
00579 #define GRE_VERSION_MASK                        0x0007
00580 
00581 #define GRE_VERSION_0                           0x0000
00582 #define GRE_VERSION_1                           0x0001
00583 
00584     u_int16_t type;
00585 #define GRE_SNA                                 0x0004
00586 #define GRE_OSI_NETWORK_LAYER                   0x00FE
00587 #define GRE_PUP                                 0x0200
00588 #define GRE_XNS                                 0x0600
00589 #define GRE_IP                                  0x0800
00590 #define GRE_CHAOS                               0x0804
00591 #define GRE_RFC_826_ARP                         0x0806
00592 #define GRE_FRAME_RELAY_ARP                     0x0808
00593 #define GRE_VINES                               0x0BAD
00594 #define GRE_VINES_ECHO                          0x0BAE
00595 #define GRE_VINES_LOOPBACK                      0x0BAF
00596 #define GRE_DECNET                              0x6003
00597 #define GRE_TRANSPARENT_ETHERNET_BRIDGING       0x6558
00598 #define GRE_RAW_FRAME_RELAY                     0x6559
00599 #define GRE_APOLLO_DOMAIN                       0x8019
00600 #define GRE_ETHERTALK                           0x809B
00601 #define GRE_NOVELL_IPX                          0x8137
00602 #define GRE_RFC_1144_TCP_IP_COMPRESSION         0x876B
00603 #define GRE_IP_AUTONOMOUS_SYSTEMS               0x876C
00604 #define GRE_SECURE_DATA                         0x876D
00605 #define GRE_PPP                                 0x880b /* taken from RFC 2637 */
00606 
00607     union {
00608     struct {
00609         u_int16_t sum;  /* optional */
00610         u_int16_t offset;    /* optional */
00611         u_int32_t key;        /* optional */
00612         u_int32_t seq;        /* optional */
00613     } _gre;
00614 
00615     struct {
00616         u_int16_t payload_s; /* optional */
00617         u_int16_t callID;    /* optional */
00618         u_int32_t seq;        /* optional */
00619         u_int32_t ack;        /* optional */
00620     } _egre;
00621     }_data;
00622 
00623 #define gre_sum _data._gre.sum
00624 #define gre_offset _data._gre.offset
00625 #define gre_key _data._gre.key
00626 #define gre_seq _data._gre.seq
00627 
00628 #define egre_payload_s _data._egre.payload_s
00629 #define egre_callID _data._egre.callID
00630 #define egre_seq _data._egre.seq
00631 #define egre_ack _data._egre.ack
00632 };
00633 
00634 
00635 #ifndef IPPROTO_GRE
00636 #define IPPROTO_GRE 47
00637 #endif
00638 
00639 /*
00640  * Source Route Entries (SRE)
00641  * This is used for GRE as the Routing field is a list of SREs - RFC 1701
00642  * Base header size: 4 bytes
00643  */
00644 struct libnet_gre_sre_hdr
00645 {
00646     u_int16_t af;  /* address familly */
00647     u_int8_t sre_offset;
00648     u_int8_t sre_length;
00649     u_int8_t *routing;
00650 };

00653 /*
00654  *  IPv4 header
00655  *  Internet Protocol, version 4
00656  *  Static header size: 20 bytes
00657  */
00658 struct libnet_ipv4_hdr
00659 {
00660 #if (LIBNET_LIL_ENDIAN)
00661     u_int8_t ip_hl:4,      /* header length */
00662            ip_v:4;         /* version */
00663 #endif
00664 #if (LIBNET_BIG_ENDIAN)
00665     u_int8_t ip_v:4,       /* version */
00666            ip_hl:4;        /* header length */
00667 #endif
00668     u_int8_t ip_tos;       /* type of service */
00669 #ifndef IPTOS_LOWDELAY
00670 #define IPTOS_LOWDELAY      0x10
00671 #endif
00672 #ifndef IPTOS_THROUGHPUT
00673 #define IPTOS_THROUGHPUT    0x08
00674 #endif
00675 #ifndef IPTOS_RELIABILITY
00676 #define IPTOS_RELIABILITY   0x04
00677 #endif
00678 #ifndef IPTOS_LOWCOST
00679 #define IPTOS_LOWCOST       0x02
00680 #endif
00681     u_int16_t ip_len;         /* total length */
00682     u_int16_t ip_id;          /* identification */
00683     u_int16_t ip_off;
00684 #ifndef IP_RF
00685 #define IP_RF 0x8000        /* reserved fragment flag */
00686 #endif
00687 #ifndef IP_DF
00688 #define IP_DF 0x4000        /* dont fragment flag */
00689 #endif
00690 #ifndef IP_MF
00691 #define IP_MF 0x2000        /* more fragments flag */
00692 #endif 
00693 #ifndef IP_OFFMASK
00694 #define IP_OFFMASK 0x1fff   /* mask for fragmenting bits */
00695 #endif
00696     u_int8_t ip_ttl;          /* time to live */
00697     u_int8_t ip_p;            /* protocol */
00698     u_int16_t ip_sum;         /* checksum */
00699     struct in_addr ip_src, ip_dst; /* source and dest address */
00700 };
00701 
00702 /*
00703  *  IP options
00704  */
00705 #ifndef IPOPT_EOL
00706 #define IPOPT_EOL       0   /* end of option list */
00707 #endif
00708 #ifndef IPOPT_NOP
00709 #define IPOPT_NOP       1   /* no operation */
00710 #endif   
00711 #ifndef IPOPT_RR
00712 #define IPOPT_RR        7   /* record packet route */
00713 #endif
00714 #ifndef IPOPT_TS
00715 #define IPOPT_TS        68  /* timestamp */
00716 #endif
00717 #ifndef IPOPT_SECURITY
00718 #define IPOPT_SECURITY  130 /* provide s,c,h,tcc */   
00719 #endif
00720 #ifndef IPOPT_LSRR
00721 #define IPOPT_LSRR      131 /* loose source route */
00722 #endif
00723 #ifndef IPOPT_SATID
00724 #define IPOPT_SATID     136 /* satnet id */
00725 #endif
00726 #ifndef IPOPT_SSRR
00727 #define IPOPT_SSRR      137 /* strict source route */
00728 #endif

00730 /*
00731  * IPv6 address
00732  */
00733 struct libnet_in6_addr
00734 {
00735     union
00736     {
00737         u_int8_t   __u6_addr8[16];
00738         u_int16_t  __u6_addr16[8];
00739         u_int32_t  __u6_addr32[4];
00740     } __u6_addr;            /* 128-bit IP6 address */
00741 };
00742 #define libnet_s6_addr __u6_addr.__u6_addr8
00743 
00744 /*
00745  *  IPv6 header
00746  *  Internet Protocol, version 6
00747  *  Static header size: 40 bytes
00748  */
00749 struct libnet_ipv6_hdr
00750 {
00751     u_int8_t ip_flags[4];     /* version, traffic class, flow label */
00752     u_int16_t ip_len;         /* total length */
00753     u_int8_t ip_nh;           /* next header */
00754     u_int8_t ip_hl;           /* hop limit */
00755     struct libnet_in6_addr ip_src, ip_dst; /* source and dest address */
00756 
00757 };
00758 
00759 /*
00760  *  IPv6 frag header
00761  *  Internet Protocol, version 6
00762  *  Static header size: 8 bytes
00763  */
00764 #define LIBNET_IPV6_NH_FRAGMENT 44
00765 struct libnet_ipv6_frag_hdr
00766 {
00767     u_int8_t ip_nh;          /* next header */
00768     u_int8_t ip_reserved;    /* reserved */
00769     u_int16_t ip_frag;       /* fragmentation stuff */
00770     u_int32_t ip_id;         /* id */
00771 };
00772 
00773 /*
00774  *  IPv6 routing header
00775  *  Internet Protocol, version 6
00776  *  Base header size: 4 bytes
00777  */
00778 #define LIBNET_IPV6_NH_ROUTING  43
00779 struct libnet_ipv6_routing_hdr
00780 {
00781     u_int8_t ip_nh;          /* next header */
00782     u_int8_t ip_len;         /* length of header in 8 octet units (sans 1st) */
00783     u_int8_t ip_rtype;       /* routing type */
00784     u_int8_t ip_segments;    /* segments left */
00785     /* routing information allocated dynamically */
00786 };
00787 
00788 /*
00789  *  IPv6 destination options header
00790  *  Internet Protocol, version 6
00791  *  Base header size: 2 bytes
00792  */
00793 #define LIBNET_IPV6_NH_DESTOPTS 60
00794 struct libnet_ipv6_destopts_hdr
00795 {
00796     u_int8_t ip_nh;          /* next header */
00797     u_int8_t ip_len;         /* length of header in 8 octet units (sans 1st) */
00798     /* destination options information allocated dynamically */
00799 };
00800 
00801 /*
00802  *  IPv6 hop by hop options header
00803  *  Internet Protocol, version 6
00804  *  Base header size: 2 bytes
00805  */
00806 #define LIBNET_IPV6_NH_HBH      0
00807 struct libnet_ipv6_hbhopts_hdr
00808 {
00809     u_int8_t ip_nh;          /* next header */
00810     u_int8_t ip_len;         /* length of header in 8 octet units (sans 1st) */
00811     /* destination options information allocated dynamically */
00812 };

00817  *  Base header size: 8 bytes
00818  */
00819 #ifndef IPPROTO_ICMP6
00820 #define IPPROTO_ICMP6   0x3a
00821 #endif
00822 struct libnet_icmpv6_hdr
00823 {

00825 #ifndef ICMP6_ECHO
00826 #define ICMP6_ECHO          128
00827 #endif

00829 #define ICMP6_ECHOREPLY     129
00830 #endif
00831 #ifndef ICMP6_UNREACH
00832 #define ICMP6_UNREACH       1
00833 #endif
00834 #ifndef ICMP6_PKTTOOBIG
00835 #define ICMP6_PKTTOOBIG     2
00836 #endif
00837 #ifndef ICMP6_TIMXCEED
00838 #define ICMP6_TIMXCEED      3
00839 #endif
00840 #ifndef ICMP6_PARAMPROB
00841 #define ICMP6_PARAMPROB     4
00842 #endif
00843     u_int8_t icmp_code;       /* ICMP code */
00844     u_int16_t icmp_sum;       /* ICMP Checksum */
00845     u_int16_t id;             /* ICMP id */
00846     u_int16_t seq;            /* ICMP sequence number */
00847 };

00851 /*
00852  *  ICMP header
00853  *  Internet Control Message Protocol
00854  *  Base header size: 4 bytes
00855  */
00856 struct libnet_icmpv4_hdr
00857 {
00858     u_int8_t icmp_type;       /* ICMP type */
00859 #ifndef     ICMP_ECHOREPLY
00860 #define     ICMP_ECHOREPLY                  0
00861 #endif
00862 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH
00863 #define     ICMP_UNREACH                    3
00864 #endif
00865 #ifndef     ICMP_SOURCEQUENCH
00866 #define     ICMP_SOURCEQUENCH               4
00867 #endif
00868 #ifndef     ICMP_REDIRECT
00869 #define     ICMP_REDIRECT                   5
00870 #endif
00871 #ifndef     ICMP_ECHO
00872 #define     ICMP_ECHO                       8
00873 #endif
00874 #ifndef     ICMP_ROUTERADVERT
00875 #define     ICMP_ROUTERADVERT               9
00876 #endif
00877 #ifndef     ICMP_ROUTERSOLICIT
00878 #define     ICMP_ROUTERSOLICIT              10
00879 #endif
00880 #ifndef     ICMP_TIMXCEED
00881 #define     ICMP_TIMXCEED                   11
00882 #endif
00883 #ifndef     ICMP_PARAMPROB
00884 #define     ICMP_PARAMPROB                  12
00885 #endif
00886 #ifndef     ICMP_TSTAMP
00887 #define     ICMP_TSTAMP                     13
00888 #endif
00889 #ifndef     ICMP_TSTAMPREPLY
00890 #define     ICMP_TSTAMPREPLY                14
00891 #endif
00892 #ifndef     ICMP_IREQ
00893 #define     ICMP_IREQ                       15
00894 #endif
00895 #ifndef     ICMP_IREQREPLY
00896 #define     ICMP_IREQREPLY                  16
00897 #endif
00898 #ifndef     ICMP_MASKREQ
00899 #define     ICMP_MASKREQ                    17
00900 #endif
00901 #ifndef     ICMP_MASKREPLY
00902 #define     ICMP_MASKREPLY                  18
00903 #endif
00904     u_int8_t icmp_code;       /* ICMP code */
00905 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_NET
00906 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_NET                0
00907 #endif
00908 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST
00909 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST               1
00910 #endif
00911 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_PROTOCOL
00912 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_PROTOCOL           2
00913 #endif
00914 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_PORT
00915 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_PORT               3
00916 #endif
00917 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_NEEDFRAG
00918 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_NEEDFRAG           4
00919 #endif
00920 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_SRCFAIL
00921 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_SRCFAIL            5
00922 #endif
00923 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_NET_UNKNOWN
00924 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_NET_UNKNOWN        6
00925 #endif
00926 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_UNKNOWN
00927 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_UNKNOWN       7
00928 #endif
00929 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_ISOLATED
00930 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_ISOLATED           8
00931 #endif
00932 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_NET_PROHIB
00933 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_NET_PROHIB         9
00934 #endif
00935 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_PROHIB
00936 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_PROHIB        10
00937 #endif
00938 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_TOSNET
00939 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_TOSNET             11
00940 #endif
00941 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_TOSHOST
00942 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_TOSHOST            12
00943 #endif
00944 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_FILTER_PROHIB
00945 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_FILTER_PROHIB      13
00946 #endif
00947 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_PRECEDENCE
00948 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_HOST_PRECEDENCE    14
00949 #endif
00950 #ifndef     ICMP_UNREACH_PRECEDENCE_CUTOFF
00951 #define     ICMP_UNREACH_PRECEDENCE_CUTOFF  15
00952 #endif
00953 #ifndef     ICMP_REDIRECT_NET
00954 #define     ICMP_REDIRECT_NET               0
00955 #endif
00956 #ifndef     ICMP_REDIRECT_HOST
00957 #define     ICMP_REDIRECT_HOST              1
00958 #endif
00959 #ifndef     ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSNET
00960 #define     ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSNET            2
00961 #endif
00962 #ifndef     ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSHOST
00963 #define     ICMP_REDIRECT_TOSHOST           3
00964 #endif
00965 #ifndef     ICMP_TIMXCEED_INTRANS
00966 #define     ICMP_TIMXCEED_INTRANS           0
00967 #endif
00968 #ifndef     ICMP_TIMXCEED_REASS
00969 #define     ICMP_TIMXCEED_REASS             1
00970 #endif
00971 #ifndef     ICMP_PARAMPROB_OPTABSENT
00972 #define     ICMP_PARAMPROB_OPTABSENT        1
00973 #endif
00974 
00975     u_int16_t icmp_sum;   /* ICMP Checksum */
00976 
00977     union
00978     {
00979         struct
00980         {
00981             u_int16_t id; /* ICMP id */
00982             u_int16_t seq;/* ICMP sequence number */
00983         } echo;
00984 
00985 #undef icmp_id
00986 #undef icmp_seq
00987 #define icmp_id     hun.echo.id
00988 #define icmp_seq    hun.echo.seq
00989  
00990         u_int32_t gateway; /* gateway host */
00991         struct
00992         {
00993             u_int16_t pad;/* padding */
00994             u_int16_t mtu;/* MTU size */
00995         } frag;
00996     } hun;
00997     union
00998     {
00999         struct
01000         {
01001             n_time its_otime;
01002             n_time its_rtime;
01003             n_time its_ttime;
01004         } ts;
01005         struct
01006         {
01007             struct libnet_ipv4_hdr idi_ip;
01008             /* options and then 64 bits of data */
01009         } ip;
01010         u_int32_t mask;
01011         int8_t data[1];
01012 
01013 #undef icmp_mask
01014 #define icmp_mask    dun.mask
01015 #undef icmp_data
01016 #define icmp_data    dun.data
01017 
01018 #undef icmp_otime
01019 #define icmp_otime   dun.ts.its_otime
01020 #undef icmp_rtime
01021 #define icmp_rtime   dun.ts.its_rtime
01022 #undef icmp_ttime
01023 #define icmp_ttime   dun.ts.its_ttime
01024     }dun;
01025 };

01027 
01028 /*
01029  *  IGMP header
01030  *  Internet Group Message Protocol
01031  *  Static header size: 8 bytes
01032  */
01033 struct libnet_igmp_hdr
01034 {
01035     u_int8_t igmp_type;       /* IGMP type */
01036 #ifndef IGMP_MEMBERSHIP_QUERY
01037 #define IGMP_MEMBERSHIP_QUERY           0x11    /* membership query */
01038 #endif
01039 #ifndef IGMP_V1_MEMBERSHIP_REPORT
01040 #define IGMP_V1_MEMBERSHIP_REPORT       0x12    /* Ver. 1 membership report */
01041 #endif
01042 #ifndef IGMP_V2_MEMBERSHIP_REPORT
01043 #define IGMP_V2_MEMBERSHIP_REPORT       0x16    /* Ver. 2 membership report */
01044 #endif
01045 #ifndef IGMP_LEAVE_GROUP
01046 #define IGMP_LEAVE_GROUP                0x17    /* Leave-group message */
01047 #endif
01048     u_int8_t igmp_code;       /* IGMP code */
01049     u_int16_t igmp_sum;       /* IGMP checksum */
01050     struct in_addr igmp_group;/* IGMP host IP */
01051 };
01052 
01053 
01054 /*
01055  *  IPSEC header
01056  *  Internet Protocol Security Protocol
01057  *  Encapsulating Security Payload Header Static header size: 12 bytes
01058  *  Encapsulating Security Payload Footer Base header size: 2 bytes
01059  *  Authentication Header Static Size: 16 bytes
01060  */
01061 #ifndef IPPROTO_ESP
01062 #define IPPROTO_ESP 50      /* not everyone's got this */
01063 #endif
01064 struct libnet_esp_hdr
01065 {
01066    u_int32_t esp_spi;          /* security parameter index */
01067    u_int32_t esp_seq;          /* ESP sequence number */
01068    u_int32_t esp_iv;           /* initialization vector */
01069 };
01070 
01071 struct libnet_esp_ftr
01072 {
01073     u_int8_t esp_pad_len;     /* padding length */
01074     u_int8_t esp_nh;     /* next header pointer */
01075     int8_t *esp_auth;         /* authentication data */
01076 };
01077  
01078 #ifndef IPPROTO_AH
01079 #define IPPROTO_AH 51       /* not everyone's got this */
01080 #endif
01081 struct libnet_ah_hdr
01082 {
01083     u_int8_t ah_nh;      /* next header */
01084     u_int8_t ah_len;          /* payload length */
01085     u_int16_t ah_res;         /* reserved */
01086     u_int32_t ah_spi;          /* security parameter index  */
01087     u_int32_t ah_seq;          /* AH sequence number */
01088     u_int32_t ah_auth;         /* authentication data */
01089 };
01090 
01091 
01092 /*
01093  *  For checksum stuff -- IANA says 135-254 is "unassigned" as of 12.2001.
01094  *  Let's hope this one stays that way for a while!
01095  */
01096 #define LIBNET_PROTO_ISL    201
01097 /*
01098  *  ISL header
01099  *  Cisco Inter-Switch Link
01100  *  Static header size: 26 bytes
01101  */
01102 struct libnet_isl_hdr
01103 {
01104     u_int8_t isl_dhost[5];    /* destination address "01:00:0c:00:00" */
01105 #if (LIBNET_LIL_ENDIAN)
01106     u_int8_t isl_type:4,      /* type of frame */
01107            isl_user:4;      /* user defined bits */
01108 #endif
01109 #if (LIBNET_BIG_ENDIAN)
01110     u_int8_t isl_user:4,      /* user defined bits */
01111            isl_type:4;      /* type of frame */
01112 #endif
01113     u_int8_t isl_shost[6];    /* source address */
01114     u_int16_t isl_len;        /* total length of packet - 18 bytes */
01115     u_int8_t isl_snap[6];     /* 0xaaaa03 + vendor code */
01116     u_int16_t isl_vid;        /* 15 bit VLAN ID, 1 bit BPDU / CDP indicator */
01117     u_int16_t isl_index;      /* port index */
01118     u_int16_t isl_reserved;   /* used for FDDI and token ring */
01119     /* ethernet frame and 4 byte isl crc */
01120 };
01121 
01122 #ifndef IPPROTO_OSPF
01123 #define IPPROTO_OSPF    89  /* not everyone's got this */
01124 #endif
01125 #define IPPROTO_OSPF_LSA    890     /* made this up.  Hope it's unused */
01126 #define LIBNET_MODX         4102    /* used in LSA checksum */
01127 
01128 /*
01129  *  Options used in multiple OSPF packets
01130  *  More info can be found in section A.2 of RFC 2328.
01131  */
01132 #define LIBNET_OPT_EBIT  0x02 /* describes the way AS-external-LSAs are flooded */
01133 #define LIBNET_OPT_MCBIT 0x04 /* whether or not IP multicast dgrams are fwdd */
01134 #define LIBNET_OPT_NPBIT 0x08 /* describes handling of type-7 LSAs */
01135 #define LIBNET_OPT_EABIT 0x10 /* rtr's willingness to send/recv EA-LSAs */
01136 #define LIBNET_OPT_DCBIT 0x20 /* describes handling of demand circuits */
01137 
01138 
01139 /*
01140  *  MPLS header
01141  *  Multi-Protocol Label Switching
01142  *  Static header size: 4 bytes
01143  */
01144 struct libnet_mpls_hdr
01145 {
01146     u_int32_t mpls_les;          /* 20 bits label, 3 bits exp, 1 bit bos, ttl */
01147 #define LIBNET_MPLS_BOS_ON    1
01148 #define LIBNET_MPLS_BOS_OFF   0
01149 };
01150 
01151 /*
01152  *  NTP header
01153  *  Network Time Protocol
01154  *  Static header size: 48 bytes
01155  */
01156 struct libnet_ntp_hdr_l_fp  /* int32_t floating point (64-bit) */
01157 {
01158     u_int32_t integer;         /* integer */
01159     u_int32_t fraction;        /* fraction */
01160 };
01161 
01162 struct libnet_ntp_hdr_s_fp  /* int16_t floating point (32-bit) */
01163 {
01164     u_int16_t integer;        /* integer */
01165     u_int16_t fraction;       /* fraction */
01166 };
01167 
01168 
01169 struct libnet_ntp_hdr
01170 {
01171     u_int8_t ntp_li_vn_mode;              /* leap indicator, version, mode */
01172 #define LIBNET_NTP_LI_NW    0x0         /* no warning */
01173 #define LIBNET_NTP_LI_AS    0x1         /* last minute has 61 seconds */
01174 #define LIBNET_NTP_LI_DS    0x2         /* last minute has 59 seconds */
01175 #define LIBNET_NTP_LI_AC    0x3         /* alarm condition */
01176 
01177 #define LIBNET_NTP_VN_2     0x2         /* version 2 */
01178 #define LIBNET_NTP_VN_3     0x3         /* version 3 */
01179 #define LIBNET_NTP_VN_4     0x4         /* version 4 */
01180 
01181 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_R   0x0         /* reserved */
01182 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_A   0x1         /* symmetric active */
01183 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_P   0x2         /* symmetric passive */
01184 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_C   0x3         /* client */
01185 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_S   0x4         /* server */
01186 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_B   0x5         /* broadcast */
01187 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_RC  0x6         /* reserved for NTP control message */
01188 #define LIBNET_NTP_MODE_RP  0x7         /* reserved for private use */
01189     u_int8_t ntp_stratum;                 /* stratum */
01190 #define LIBNET_NTP_STRATUM_UNAVAIL  0x0 /* unspecified or unavailable */
01191 #define LIBNET_NTP_STRATUM_PRIMARY  0x1 /* primary reference (radio clock) */
01192                                         /* 2 - 15 is secondary */
01193                                         /* 16 - 255 is reserved */
01194     u_int8_t ntp_poll;                    /* poll interval (should be 4 - 12) */
01195     u_int8_t ntp_precision;               /* local clock precision */
01196     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_s_fp ntp_delay;       /* roundtrip delay */
01197     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_s_fp ntp_dispersion;  /* nominal error */
01198     u_int32_t ntp_reference_id;                /* reference source id */
01199 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_LOCAL    0x4c4f434c  /* uncalibrated local clock */
01200 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_PPS      0x50505300  /* atomic / pulse-per-second clock */
01201 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_ACTS     0x41435453  /* NIST dialup modem */
01202 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_USNO     0x55534e4f  /* USNO modem service */
01203 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_PTB      0x50544200  /* PTB (German) modem service */ 
01204 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_TDF      0x54444600  /* Allouis (French) radio */
01205 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_DCF      0x44434600  /* Mainflingen (German) radio */
01206 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_MSF      0x4d534600  /* Rugby (UK) radio */
01207 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_WWV      0x57575600  /* Ft Collins (US) radio */
01208 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_WWVB     0x57575642  /* Boulder (US) radio */
01209 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_WWVH     0x57575648  /* Kaui Hawaii (US) radio */
01210 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_CHU      0x43485500  /* Ottaha (Canada) radio */
01211 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_LORC     0x4c4f5243  /* LORAN-C radionavigation */
01212 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_OMEG     0x4f4d4547  /* OMEGA radionavigation */
01213 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_GPS      0x47505300  /* global positioning system */
01214 #define LIBNET_NTP_REF_GOES     0x474f4553  /* geostationary orbit env satellite */
01215     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_l_fp ntp_ref_ts;  /* reference timestamp */ 
01216     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_l_fp ntp_orig_ts; /* originate timestamp */
01217     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_l_fp ntp_rec_ts;  /* receive timestamp */
01218     struct libnet_ntp_hdr_l_fp ntp_xmt_ts;  /* transmit timestamp */
01219 };
01220 
01221 
01222 /*
01223  *  OSPFv2 header
01224  *  Open Shortest Path First
01225  *  Static header size: 16 bytes
01226  */
01227 struct libnet_ospf_hdr
01228 {
01229     u_int8_t ospf_v;          /* version */
01230 #define OSPFVERSION         2
01231     u_int8_t ospf_type;       /* type */
01232 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_UMD    0   /* UMd monitoring packet */
01233 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_HELLO  1   /* HELLO packet */
01234 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_DBD    2   /* dataBase description packet */
01235 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_LSR    3   /* link state request packet */
01236 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_LSU    4   /* link state Update Packet */
01237 #define  LIBNET_OSPF_LSA    5   /* link state acknowledgement packet */
01238     u_int16_t   ospf_len;     /* length */
01239     struct in_addr ospf_rtr_id; /* source router ID */
01240     struct in_addr ospf_area_id;/* roam ID */
01241     u_int16_t ospf_sum;         /* checksum */
01242     u_int16_t ospf_auth_type;     /* authentication type */
01243 #define LIBNET_OSPF_AUTH_NULL   0   /* null password */
01244 #define LIBNET_OSPF_AUTH_SIMPLE 1   /* simple, plaintext, 8 int8_t password */
01245 #define LIBNET_OSPF_AUTH_MD5    2   /* MD5 */
01246 };
01247 
01248 
01249 /*
01250  *  OSPF authentication header
01251  *  Open Shortest Path First
01252  *  Static header size: 8 bytes
01253  */
01254 struct libnet_auth_hdr
01255 {
01256     u_int16_t ospf_auth_null; /* NULL */
01257     u_int8_t ospf_auth_keyid; /* authentication key ID */
01258     u_int8_t ospf_auth_len;   /* auth data length */
01259     u_int ospf_auth_seq;    /* cryptographic sequence number */
01260 };
01261 
01262 
01263 /*
01264  *  OSPF hello header
01265  *  Open Shortest Path First
01266  *  Static header size: 28 bytes
01267  */
01268 struct libnet_ospf_hello_hdr
01269 {
01270     struct in_addr hello_nmask; /* netmask associated with the interface */
01271     u_int16_t hello_intrvl;       /* num of seconds between routers last packet */
01272     u_int8_t hello_opts;          /* Options for HELLO packets (look above) */
01273     u_int8_t hello_rtr_pri;       /* router's priority (if 0, can't be backup) */
01274     u_int hello_dead_intvl;     /* # of secs a router is silent till deemed down */
01275     struct in_addr hello_des_rtr;   /* Designated router on the network */
01276     struct in_addr hello_bkup_rtr;  /* Backup router */
01277     struct in_addr hello_nbr;       /* neighbor router, memcpy more as needed */
01278 };
01279 
01280 
01281 /*
01282  *  Database Description header.
01283  */
01284 struct libnet_dbd_hdr
01285 {
01286     u_int16_t dbd_mtu_len;    /* max length of IP dgram that this 'if' can use */
01287     u_int8_t dbd_opts;        /* DBD packet options (from above) */
01288     u_int8_t dbd_type;        /* type of exchange occurring */
01289 #define LIBNET_DBD_IBI      0x01    /* init */
01290 #define LIBNET_DBD_MBIT     0x02    /* more DBD packets are to come */
01291 #define LIBNET_DBD_MSBIT    0x04    /* If 1, sender is the master in the exchange */
01292     u_int  dbd_seq;         /* DBD sequence number */
01293 };
01294 
01295 
01296 /*
01297  *  used for the LS type field in all LS* headers
01298  */
01299 #define LIBNET_LS_TYPE_RTR      1   /* router-LSA */
01300 #define LIBNET_LS_TYPE_NET      2   /* network-LSA */
01301 #define LIBNET_LS_TYPE_IP       3   /* summary-LSA (IP Network) */
01302 #define LIBNET_LS_TYPE_ASBR     4   /* summary-LSA (ASBR) */
01303 #define LIBNET_LS_TYPE_ASEXT    5   /* AS-external-LSA */
01304 
01305 
01306 /*
01307  *  Link State Request header
01308  */
01309 struct libnet_lsr_hdr
01310 {
01311     u_int lsr_type;             /* type of LS being requested */
01312     u_int lsr_lsid;             /* link state ID */
01313     struct in_addr lsr_adrtr;   /* advertising router (memcpy more as needed) */
01314 };
01315 
01316 
01317 /*
01318  *  Link State Update header
01319  */
01320 struct libnet_lsu_hdr
01321 {
01322     u_int lsu_num;              /* number of LSAs that will be broadcasted */
01323 };
01324 
01325 
01326 /*
01327  *  Link State Acknowledgement header.
01328  */
01329 struct libnet_lsa_hdr
01330 {
01331     u_int16_t lsa_age;        /* time in seconds since the LSA was originated */
01332     u_int8_t lsa_opts;        /* look above for OPTS_* */
01333     u_int8_t lsa_type;        /* look below for LS_TYPE_* */
01334     u_int lsa_id;           /* link State ID */
01335     struct in_addr lsa_adv; /* router ID of Advertising router */
01336     u_int lsa_seq;          /* LSA sequence number to detect old/bad ones */
01337     u_int16_t lsa_sum;      /* "Fletcher Checksum" of all fields minus age */
01338     u_int16_t lsa_len;        /* length in bytes including the 20 byte header */
01339 };
01340 
01341 
01342 /*
01343  *  Router LSA data format
01344  *
01345  *  Other stuff for TOS can be added for backward compatability, for this
01346  *  version, only OSPFv2 is being FULLY supported.
01347  */
01348 struct libnet_rtr_lsa_hdr
01349 {
01350     u_int16_t rtr_flags;      /* set to help describe packet */
01351 #define LIBNET_RTR_FLAGS_W  0x0100  /* W bit */
01352 #define LIBNET_RTR_FLAGS_E  0x0200  /* E bit */
01353 #define LIBNET_RTR_FLAGS_B  0x0400  /* B bit */
01354     u_int16_t rtr_num;        /* number of links within that packet */
01355     u_int rtr_link_id;      /* describes link_data (look below) */
01356 #define LIBNET_LINK_ID_NBR_ID   1   /* Neighbors router ID, also can be 4 */
01357 #define LIBNET_LINK_ID_IP_DES   2   /* IP address of designated router */
01358 #define LIBNET_LINK_ID_SUB      3   /* IP subnet number */
01359     u_int rtr_link_data;    /* Depending on link_id, info is here */
01360     u_int8_t rtr_type;        /* Description of router link */
01361 #define LIBNET_RTR_TYPE_PTP     1   /* Point-To-Point */
01362 #define LIBNET_RTR_TYPE_TRANS   2   /* Connection to a "transit network" */
01363 #define LIBNET_RTR_TYPE_STUB    3   /* Connectin to a "stub network" */
01364 #define RTR_TYPE_VRTL   4   /* connects to a "virtual link" */
01365     u_int8_t rtr_tos_num;     /* number of different TOS metrics for this link */
01366     u_int16_t rtr_metric;     /* the "cost" of using this link */
01367 };
01368 
01369 
01370 /*
01371  *  Network LSA data format.
01372  */
01373 struct libnet_net_lsa_hdr
01374 {
01375     struct in_addr net_nmask;   /* Netmask for that network */
01376     u_int  net_rtr_id;          /* ID of router attached to that network */
01377 };
01378  
01379  
01380 /*
01381  *  Summary LSA data format.
01382  */
01383 struct libnet_sum_lsa_hdr
01384 {
01385     struct in_addr sum_nmask;   /* Netmask of destination IP address */
01386     u_int  sum_metric;          /* Same as in rtr_lsa (&0xfff to use last 24bit */
01387     u_int  sum_tos_metric;      /* first 8bits are TOS, 24bits are TOS Metric */
01388 };
01389  
01390  
01391 /*
01392  *  AS External LSA data format.
01393  *  & 0xfff logic operator for as_metric to get last 24bits.
01394  */
01395 struct libnet_as_lsa_hdr
01396 {
01397     struct in_addr as_nmask;    /* Netmask for advertised destination */
01398     u_int  as_metric;           /* May have to set E bit in first 8bits */
01399 #define LIBNET_AS_E_BIT_ON 0x80000000  /* as_metric */
01400     struct in_addr as_fwd_addr; /* Forwarding address */
01401     u_int  as_rte_tag;          /* External route tag */
01402 };
01403 
01404 
01405 /*
01406  *  Base RIP header
01407  *  Routing Information Protocol
01408  *  Base header size: 24 bytes
01409  */
01410 struct libnet_rip_hdr
01411 {
01412     u_int8_t rip_cmd;         /* RIP command */
01413 #define RIPCMD_REQUEST   1  /* want info */
01414 #define RIPCMD_RESPONSE  2  /* responding to request */
01415 #define RIPCMD_TRACEON   3  /* turn tracing on */
01416 #define RIPCMD_TRACEOFF  4  /* turn it off */
01417 #define RIPCMD_POLL      5  /* like request, but anyone answers */
01418 #define RIPCMD_POLLENTRY 6  /* like poll, but for entire entry */
01419 #define RIPCMD_MAX       7  /* ? command */
01420     u_int8_t rip_ver;         /* RIP version */
01421 #define RIPVER_0         0
01422 #define RIPVER_1         1
01423 #define RIPVER_2         2
01424     u_int16_t rip_rd;         /* Zero (v1) or Routing Domain (v2) */
01425     u_int16_t rip_af;         /* Address family */
01426     u_int16_t rip_rt;         /* Zero (v1) or Route Tag (v2) */
01427     u_int32_t rip_addr;        /* IP address */
01428     u_int32_t rip_mask;        /* Zero (v1) or Subnet Mask (v2) */
01429     u_int32_t rip_next_hop;    /* Zero (v1) or Next hop IP address (v2) */
01430     u_int32_t rip_metric;      /* Metric */
01431 };
01432

01437 #define LIBNET_RPC_CALL  0
01438 #define LIBNET_RPC_REPLY 1
01439 #define LIBNET_RPC_VERS  2
01440 #define LIBNET_RPC_LAST_FRAG 0x80000000

01495 /*

01505     u_int8_t stp_flags;       /* control flags */

01507     u_int32_t stp_rootpc;      /* root path cost */

01530 /*
01531  *  TCP header
01532  *  Transmission Control Protocol
01533  *  Static header size: 20 bytes
01534  */
01535 struct libnet_tcp_hdr
01536 {
01537     u_int16_t th_sport;       /* source port */
01538     u_int16_t th_dport;       /* destination port */
01539     u_int32_t th_seq;          /* sequence number */
01540     u_int32_t th_ack;          /* acknowledgement number */
01541 #if (LIBNET_LIL_ENDIAN)
01542     u_int8_t th_x2:4,         /* (unused) */
01543            th_off:4;        /* data offset */
01544 #endif
01545 #if (LIBNET_BIG_ENDIAN)
01546     u_int8_t th_off:4,        /* data offset */
01547            th_x2:4;         /* (unused) */
01548 #endif
01549     u_int8_t  th_flags;       /* control flags */
01550 #ifndef TH_FIN
01551 #define TH_FIN    0x01      /* finished send data */
01552 #endif
01553 #ifndef TH_SYN
01554 #define TH_SYN    0x02      /* synchronize sequence numbers */
01555 #endif
01556 #ifndef TH_RST
01557 #define TH_RST    0x04      /* reset the connection */
01558 #endif
01559 #ifndef TH_PUSH
01560 #define TH_PUSH   0x08      /* push data to the app layer */
01561 #endif
01562 #ifndef TH_ACK
01563 #define TH_ACK    0x10      /* acknowledge */
01564 #endif
01565 #ifndef TH_URG
01566 #define TH_URG    0x20      /* urgent! */
01567 #endif
01568 #ifndef TH_ECE
01569 #define TH_ECE    0x40
01570 #endif
01571 #ifndef TH_CWR   
01572 #define TH_CWR    0x80
01573 #endif
01574     u_int16_t th_win;         /* window */
01575     u_int16_t th_sum;         /* checksum */
01576     u_int16_t th_urp;         /* urgent pointer */
01577 };
01578 
01579 /*
01580  *  Token Ring Header
01581  */
01582 struct libnet_token_ring_hdr
01583 {
01584     u_int8_t  token_ring_access_control;
01585 #define LIBNET_TOKEN_RING_FRAME  0x10
01586     u_int8_t  token_ring_frame_control;
01587 #define LIBNET_TOKEN_RING_LLC_FRAME  0x40
01588     u_int8_t  token_ring_dhost[TOKEN_RING_ADDR_LEN];
01589     u_int8_t  token_ring_shost[TOKEN_RING_ADDR_LEN];
01590     u_int8_t  token_ring_llc_dsap;
01591     u_int8_t  token_ring_llc_ssap;
01592     u_int8_t  token_ring_llc_control_field;
01593     u_int8_t  token_ring_llc_org_code[LIBNET_ORG_CODE_SIZE];
01594     u_int16_t token_ring_type;
01595 #define TOKEN_RING_TYPE_IP            0x0800  /* IP protocol */
01596 #define TOKEN_RING_TYPE_ARP           0x0806  /* addr. resolution protocol */
01597 #define TOKEN_RING_TYPE_REVARP        0x8035  /* reverse addr. resolution protocol */
01598 };

01618 /*
01619  *  Sebek header
01620  *  Static header size: 48 bytes
01621  */
01622 struct libnet_sebek_hdr
01623 {
01624     u_int32_t magic;           /* identify packets that should be hidden */
01625     u_int16_t version;         /* protocol version, currently 1 */
01626 #define SEBEK_PROTO_VERSION 1
01627     u_int16_t type;            /* type of record (read data is type 0, write data is type 1) */
01628 #define SEBEK_TYPE_READ     0  /* Currently, only read is supported */
01629 #define SEBEK_TYPE_WRITE    1
01630     u_int32_t counter;         /*  PDU counter used to identify when packet are lost */
01631     u_int32_t time_sec;        /* seconds since EPOCH according to the honeypot */
01632     u_int32_t time_usec;       /* residual microseconds */
01633     u_int32_t pid;             /* PID */
01634     u_int32_t uid;             /* UID */
01635     u_int32_t fd;              /* FD */
01636 #define SEBEK_CMD_LENGTH   12
01637     u_int8_t cmd[SEBEK_CMD_LENGTH]; /* 12 first characters of the command */
01638     u_int32_t length;          /* length in bytes of the PDU's body */
01639 };
01640 
01641 
01642 /*
01643  *  VRRP header
01644  *  Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol
01645  *  Static header size: 8 bytes
01646  */
01647 #ifndef IPPROTO_VRRP
01648 #define IPPROTO_VRRP 112    /* not everyone's got this */
01649 #endif
01650 struct libnet_vrrp_hdr
01651 {
01652 #if (LIBNET_LIL_ENDIAN)
01653     u_int8_t vrrp_v:4,        /* protocol version */
01654            vrrp_t:4;        /* packet type */
01655 #endif
01656 #if (LIBNET_BIG_ENDIAN)
01657     u_int8_t vrrp_t:4,        /* packet type */
01658            vrrp_v:4;        /* protocol version */
01659 #endif
01660 #define LIBNET_VRRP_VERSION_01  0x1
01661 #define LIBNET_VRRP_VERSION_02  0x2
01662 #define LIBNET_VRRP_TYPE_ADVERT 0x1
01663     u_int8_t vrrp_vrouter_id; /* virtual router id */
01664     u_int8_t vrrp_priority;   /* priority */
01665     u_int8_t vrrp_ip_count;   /* number of IP addresses */
01666     u_int8_t vrrp_auth_type;  /* authorization type */
01667 #define LIBNET_VRRP_AUTH_NONE   0x1
01668 #define LIBNET_VRRP_AUTH_PASSWD 0x2
01669 #define LIBNET_VRRP_AUTH_IPAH   0x3
01670     u_int8_t vrrp_advert_int; /* advertisement interval */
01671     u_int16_t vrrp_sum;       /* checksum */
01672     /* additional addresses */
01673     /* authentication info */
01674 };
01675 
01676 
01677 /*
01678  *  HSRP header
01679  *  Static header size: 20 bytes
01680  */
01681 struct libnet_hsrp_hdr
01682 {
01683 #define LIBNET_HSRP_VERSION 0x0
01684     u_int8_t version;           /* Version of the HSRP messages */
01685 #define LIBNET_HSRP_TYPE_HELLO 0x0
01686 #define LIBNET_HSRP_TYPE_COUP 0x1
01687 #define LIBNET_HSRP_TYPE_RESIGN 0x2
01688     u_int8_t opcode;            /* Type of message */
01689 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_INITIAL 0x0
01690 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_LEARN   0x1
01691 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_LISTEN  0x2
01692 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_SPEAK   0x4
01693 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_STANDBY 0x8
01694 #define LIBNET_HSRP_STATE_ACTIVE  0x10
01695     u_int8_t state;            /* Current state of the router */
01696     u_int8_t hello_time;       /* Period in seconds between hello messages */
01697     u_int8_t hold_time;        /* Seconds that the current hello message is valid */
01698     u_int8_t priority;         /* Priority for the election proccess */
01699     u_int8_t group;            /* Standby group */
01700     u_int8_t reserved;         /* Reserved field */
01701 #define HSRP_AUTHDATA_LENGTH  8 
01702     u_int8_t authdata[HSRP_AUTHDATA_LENGTH]; /* Password */
01703     u_int32_t virtual_ip;      /* Virtual IP address */
01704 };
01705 
01706 #endif  /* __LIBNET_HEADERS_H */
